title: New Live Recorded Music Headed to TFT in 9.18

embed.description: Here's a sneak preview from our live studio recording session for the music of #TeamfightTactics, coming to you in patch 9.18! I'm so hyped for everyone to hear this. #gameaudio #loldev #tft https://t.co/HnQKf5Jx54

body:
In patch 9.18, we're adding new live recorded music to Teamfight Tactics! Through development and beta, the audio team was very happy with where the musical themes for TFT landed, which mainly consisted of synthesized musical instruments. In our effort to make the music as high quality and polished as possible, we decided to go into the studio to live record extremely talented musicians to capture real human performances of the music for TFT.

As a quick primer into the adaptive music system in TFT, the music will change based on what phase of the game you're in. For instance, during shopping phase the music is calmer and less busy, but as battle phase starts the music transitions into a more energetic combat driven style. There are also 3 different “chapters” of music: the first chapter goes from the beginning of the game to when first player is knocked out. The second is from that point until there are only 3 players left. Then the final chapter brings us home.

We’re still ironing out some bugs so please bear with us and let us know if you notice any weird things like volume spikes or musical stems playing over each other. We hope the new music makes your TFT games that much better!

replies.body:
Ha, that's a great analogy!

We definitely wanted a game of TFT to have an emotional arc. So the first Act is pretty relaxed and exciting. The second Act adds a little bit of conflict and drama. Finally, the third Act is epic with a sense of drive to a resolution. It was really awesome working on this system with Kole, the composer for TFT. I'm sure he can go into much more details. :)

We share your excitement in experiencing it with y'all soon!

Music is one of my favorite parts of the games I play, and League doesn't really have a lot of in-game music; champ select is really the only time the music has pathos.  So I'm pumped to read that!  I'd definitely like to hear more about it!
Ampson, to give more feel to the game i would suggest putting more quotes from champions during/after/before a fight, maybe not random quotes like now, but appropriate for the moment
actually fighting a specific champion and have yours yell something at them would be cool, not just random quote that may or may not play when you  aa them but while fighting them in general

Where was this energy with Nexus Blitz? It didn't even have a proper map :| And TFT keeps getting stuff over and over, not mad about it tho but it makes you wonder sometimes.
Regardless... Good job it sounds amazing! The sound/art team always make some amazing stuff.
I really want to see Sheet Music for this! I love the music so much!

While final 3 is a nice number to begin the last chapter of music, how about 4? somewhat like semifinals before the last 3, as the time between 7 players remaining and 3 players remaining can last a good while.
Will there be a selected suite of the music uploaded to soundcloud?

If that clip is any indication, I love the "driving" sound!  It reminds me of something by Akira Ifukube.  Where the tempo is energetic and exciting, but the melody/chord progression sounds subdued, making it feel dramatic and effortless, like a strong wind (hope I don't sound weird using an analogy like that).
Adaptive music is really cool when it's used to make an experience feel "complete", so having the three "chapters" really excites me.  It helps frame the whole game as a singular, complete drama.  Kind of like the opening/ending credits of a film, or the title screen of other video games, or even just the act of opening up physical media.

I'm SUPER excited to hear the whole thing!
